Source: Blood|Human vascular smooth muscle cell|Primary cell
EV isolated method: Serum-free conditioned media was collected after 48 h incubation with hVSMCs and centrifuged at 1,000 rpm, 2,000 rpm, and 4,000 rpm for 10–15 min at 4°C to remove cells, apoptotic bodies, and large debris. The media was centrifuged at 100,000 g for 90 min at 4°C using the SW41Ti Rotor (Beckman Coulter, Brea, CA) with 60% sucrose cushion. Interphase was collected and centrifuged again with the sucrose cushion at 110,000 g for 12 h at 4°C. The interphase enriched with exosomes was collected, washed, and pelleted with 1× PBS at 110,000 g for 2 h at 4°C. Pellet containing exosomes were resuspended in either RIPA buffer or Qiazol (Qiagen, Germany) for protein analysis or RNA extraction, respectively.
